intro: Cerastium barberi, commonly known as the Sierra Point bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Cerastium barberi is often found in rocky soils and open areas, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions.
